ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Nor is he miserly with the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: He is not chary of making public what is unknown.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: nor does he grudge (conveying this knowledge about) the Unseen;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: He (Muhammad) is not accused of lying about the unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And this Prophet is not miserly upon the hidden. (Allah gave the knowledge of the hidden to the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And he withholds not a knowledge of the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nor of the unseen is he a tenacious concealer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: he is not niggardly of the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And he is not avid of the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: He is not avid of the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And he is of the unseen not a tenacious concealer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and he is not miserly concerning the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Neither doth he withhold grudgingly a knowledge of the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And he (Muhammad (Peace be upon him)) withholds not a knowledge of the unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: he is not grudging of the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And He does not withhold knowledge of the Unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And Muhammad is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [81:24] and he, Muhammad (s), is not to be accused of [knowing] the Unseen, what is hidden of the revelation and the tidings of the heaven (a variant reading [for bi-zanīnin] has bi-danīnin, meaning that he is not ‘niggardly’ [with the Unseen] so as to reduce something of it [and not disclose it]).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And he is not) i.e. Muhammad (pbuh) (avid of the Unseen) he is accused with regard to the revelation; and it is also said this means: he is not avaricious.
